Header: Imran to be invited to Constitution’s golden jubilee celebrations
Summary: NA speaker to invite the PTI chief as party head
Detail:
National Assembly (NA) Speaker Raja Pervez Ashraf has decided to invite Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) Chairman Imran Khan to participate in the golden jubilee celebrations of the Constitution starting this week.
The former prime minister will be invited as the party head.
According to sources in the speaker's office, the golden jubilee celebrations of the Constitution will begin this week. The golden jubilee anniversary of the Constitution of Pakistan will be celebrated on April 10.
Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif will be the chief guest of the main event.
Also read: Senate celebrates Golden Jubilee
Sources say that it has been decided to invite the PTI chief to participate in the Golden Jubilee celebrations.
In this regard, the former premier will be invited as the party head. However, it will be his choice whether he comes himself or sends his representative.
According to sources, the speaker will invite the heads of all political parties.
The invitations to the heads of all political and parliamentary parties, including Imran, will be issued this week.

Header: PTI reaches out to JI to ‘save judiciary’
Summary: Both parties agreed on decreasing the communication gap between them
Detail:
Pakistan Tehreek e Insaf (PTI) Secretary General Asad Umar has met Jamaat e Islami chief Siraj ul Haq at the politico-religious party headquarter Mansoora Markaz in a bid to fuel the “save the Judiciary” movement. 
PTI Senator Ejaz Ahmed Chaudhry was also accompanying the secretary general in the meeting.
The two parties exchanged thoughts on the country’s political situation as they agreed on decreasing the communication gap between them.
They also converged on the point that the only way out of the current crises was Pakistan’s consensual Constitution and democratic system.
